title: (x) Print Magazine serif face - Lexicon No. 2 {Yves}
content:
Do you know which fonts are used for the magazine "print"

Sorry i have no scan.
author: jawbox

comments.content: Oh sorry i mean the serif font, not the headline font. Is this font also custom?

I think its, [Dolly](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013055035/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3?id1=dolly&id2=overview) by Underware, perhaps with a custom medium weight thrown in. Dolly just has regular and bold weights.
No Print uses ... ah! I'm suddenly pulling a blank! I know the rounded face is custom from Hoefler & Frere-Jones.
Nope, not Dolly. Just found the issue that was in the TypeCon goodie bag. Gimme a minnit.

[Bram De Does](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013055035/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Bram%20De%20Does)' [Lexicon No. 2 Roman A](http://web.archive.org/web/20131013055035/http:/www.teff.nl/fonts/lexicon/lexicon.html). A tad pricey, but very beautiful.

Oh nice. Thanks a lot.

But you are right. Very expensive. But i think Dolly is a good alternative.

_Bram De Does’ Lexicon No. 2 Roman A._

Rats, foiled! :) I just made that discovery last night while flipping through Print.
Hehehe. Gotta be fast around here. ;^)
